tea_bea: I’m sure this will make for less sexy television than whatever we’re going to see on this show, but for me and most of the people I know, the way we handle it is not much different from how anyone handles having multiple things going on in their lives. If you have one partner, a job, a class you take, friends, and a volunteering obligation, you divide up your time between those priorities. It’s the same when you have more than one partner. There might be more feelings involved when your priorities include more than one romantic or sexual partner, but let’s also not pretend that monogamous couples don’t struggle with issues of jealousy or feeling imbalanced between their relationship and their jobs/friends/hobbies. A lot do. That’s an issue for a lot of people—it’s not just about sex with other people. A lot of the time/for a lot of people, polyamory is not some sort of nonstop group hottubbing and communal living thing. It’s really just like anyone who does more than one thing with their time. I don’t even like doing that many things! It can be as boring as you’d like it to be! The way I usually describe my polyamory is honestly “I watch Netflix on more than one couch on a regular basis.” 🤷🏻‍♀️
